title: 107_hr181
content: The "Truth in Water Transportation Budgeting Act" is the short title of the Act. It addresses the budgetary treatment of the Inland Waterways Trust Fund and Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund. The "Truth in Water Transportation Budgeting Act" exempts the receipts and disbursements of the Inland Waterways Trust Fund and the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund from budgetary calculations and limitations on expenditures to prevent deficit spending. The Secretary of the Army, in consultation with the Secretary of the Treasury, estimates unfunded inland waterways authorizations and net receipts annually. If there is excess unfunded inland waterways authorizations, the Secretary determines the amount of the excess. The Secretary of the Army determines the percentage of excess unfunded authorizations for the next fiscal year and adjusts the amounts authorized to be appropriated from the Trust Fund accordingly. The Secretary of the Army adjusts the amounts authorized to be appropriated from the Trust Fund based on the percentage of excess unfunded authorizations for the next fiscal year. If the amount previously withheld does not exceed the specified limit, the reduced amounts will be increased by an equal percentage without exceeding the limit. The Secretary of the Army reports estimates and determinations to Congress as required by subsections (a), (b), (c), and (d). SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Act provides definitions for the Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund, Inland Waterways Trust Fund, net harbor maintenance receipts, and net inland waterways receipts. The Act defines "unfunded inland waterways authorizations" and "unfunded harbor maintenance authorizations" as the excess of authorized appropriations not yet funded from their respective trust funds. The Harbor Maintenance Trust Fund amount is used for appropriations. This Act applies to fiscal years starting after September 30, 2001.
